author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Auburn Athletes Glynn, Tordoff Earn NCEA Riders of the Month Honors
text:
Auburn Athletes Glynn, Tordoff Earn NCEA Riders of the Month Honors
Sophomore Avery Glynn and junior Alexia Tordoff have been recognized as the National Collegiate Equestrian Association (NCEA) Arion Sellier Riders of the Month for March. Glynn achieved a perfect record in Fences, culminating in a 3-0-0 performance this month, while Tordoff excelled in Horsemanship, also securing three wins. These honors mark the first NCEA awards for both riders, showcasing their standout contributions to their team's success.By the Numbers
- Avery Glynn achieved a 3-0-0 record in Fences for March, improving her overall season record to 11-0-0.
- Alexia Tordoff posted a 3-0-0 record in March, bringing her overall record to 13-1-0 in Horsemanship.
While Glynn and Tordoff have demonstrated exceptional skill, their recent performances also underline the continued competitive pressures facing collegiate equestrian athletes across the league.State of Play
- Glynn consistently finished with high scores, including a season-high 90 in her recent road victory against SMU.
- Tordoff ended the regular season with an impressive average of 76, helping her team to maintain a strong overall record.
Looking ahead, both riders are expected to play crucial roles in their team's performance in upcoming competitions, aiming for further honors in the NCEA championships.Bottom Line
The recognition of Glynn and Tordoff as NCEA Riders of the Month highlights their talent and dedication, setting the stage for future achievements in collegiate equestrian competitions.
